intro: Acronema graminifolium, commonly known as the slender-leaved acronema, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in umbels. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological studies and horticultural research.
